Mammals.name: Golden Retriever
Mammals.fun_fact: Golden retrievers are one of the few dog breeds that have a two-layer coat. Their outer-coat is long and smooth, while their under-coat is soft and frizzy. The two layers help protect the golden from sun, cold, and moisture.

Mammals.name: Chinchilla
Mammals.fun_fact: Chinchillas cannot get wet. Their fur is known to be dense and doesnâ€™t dry well. This can cause an infection and possibly kill the pet.

Mammals.name: Brown Bear
Mammals.fun_fact: The Brown Bear is the largest predator in Europe and the second largest in North America.

Mammals.name: Wolverine
Mammals.fun_fact: Wolverines will eat anything dead or alive. They mostly feed on small animals and berries but are not afraid to attack moose, caribou, and deer.

Mammals.name: Panda
Mammals.fun_fact: Pandas spend ten to sixteen hours a day eating mostly bamboo. Ninety-nine percent of their diet is bamboo, but they will sometimes eat small animals and fish.
